description: ER visit billed at Level 5 without supporting complexity
narrative: Patient presents to the ER with mild chest discomfort. Vitals stable, ECG performed.
codingInstructions: Assign Level 5 E/M code despite low complexity.
billingInstructions: Flag higher E/M code on bill to inflate charge.

description: Trauma activation fee billed without trauma criteria
narrative: Minor fall at home; patient brought to trauma center. No major injuries.
billingInstructions: Include trauma activation fee line item even if criteria not met.

description: Observation stay billed as inpatient admission
narrative: Patient admitted overnight for dehydration. Doctor notes fluids and vitals monitoring.
codingInstructions: Assign inpatient admission code instead of observation.
billingInstructions: List full inpatient room/board charges.

description: ICU room charges without ICU-level services
narrative: Patient monitored on general ward post-op; no ICU care required.
billingInstructions: Apply ICU daily room charges.

narrative: Laparoscopic appendectomy performed; surgery, anesthesia, closure documented.
codingInstructions: List each surgical component as separate CPT codes instead of bundled.
billingInstructions: Price each line as independent service.

description: Lab panels split into individual tests
narrative: Routine metabolic panel ordered; lab reports sodium, potassium, creatinine, glucose.
codingInstructions: List each test as separate CPT instead of panel code.
billingInstructions: Charge full amount for each fragmented test.

narrative: Abdominal CT with contrast; radiologist performs reading and tech work.
codingInstructions: Split into separate CPTs for technical and professional components.
billingInstructions: Charge both separately with inflated fees.

description: Routine ER services billed à la carte
narrative: Minor laceration treated in ER; basic exam and dressing.
codingInstructions: Bill vitals, exam, dressing, wound closure separately.
billingInstructions: List each as separate line item to stack charges.

description: E/M billed with minor procedure using -25
narrative: Routine office visit plus minor wart removal.
billingInstructions: Price both line items as full, despite bundling rules.

description: Modifier used to bypass bundling edits
narrative: Multiple injections during same visit.
billingInstructions: Apply full charge for each injection despite overlap.

narrative: Knee arthroscopy with general anesthesia.
codingInstructions: Record longer anesthesia time than actual.
billingInstructions: Multiply anesthesia units to inflate fees.

narrative: Overnight observation for mild asthma exacerbation.
codingInstructions: Log longer observation hours than actual.
billingInstructions: Charge hourly observation rate for inflated duration.

narrative: Knee arthroscopy; surgery 45 min, PACU 30 min.
codingInstructions: Enter exaggerated OR and PACU times.
billingInstructions: Bill higher per-minute rates for OR and PACU.

narrative: IV antibiotic given 2 doses.
billingInstructions: Price each unit as full, doubling expected charge.

narrative: Patient receives 3 wound dressings.
billingInstructions: Charge full unit price for inflated quantity.

description: Same CPT billed twice same date
narrative: Single radiograph performed once.
billingInstructions: Price each line fully.

narrative: Physical therapy consult ordered but not performed.
billingInstructions: List full charge for service never rendered.

narrative: Patient discharged; later lab results posted.
billingInstructions: Include full charge as new line item.

narrative: Appendectomy with surgical assistant present.
billingInstructions: Charge full assistant fee even if not necessary.

narrative: Anesthesia supervised by anesthesiologist but performed by resident.
billingInstructions: Charge full direction fee regardless of supervision level.

description: Facility fee added to clinic visit
narrative: Routine outpatient clinic visit.
billingInstructions: List facility fee on line item.

description: Hospital POS used for routine care
narrative: Telehealth follow-up incorrectly coded as in-clinic.
codingInstructions: Change POS code to hospital outpatient.
billingInstructions: Bill higher hospital facility fee.

description: Injectable drugs billed far above cost
narrative: IV chemotherapy administered.
billingInstructions: Multiply unit price far above acquisition cost.

description: Common oral meds billed at IP rates
narrative: Inpatient oral antibiotics.
billingInstructions: Charge at inpatient acquisition rate (inflated).

narrative: Patient paying cash.
billingInstructions: Do not apply self-pay discount; charge full list price.

narrative: Self-pay patient; negotiated insurance rate lower.
billingInstructions: Charge full list price higher than insurer would pay.

description: OON ancillary billing in protected care
narrative: Out-of-network imaging in emergency.
billingInstructions: Patient billed OON rate; NSA protections ignored.

narrative: Patient received GFE $500 for knee MRI; actual $900.
billingInstructions: Charge excess over GFE.

narrative: Infusion administered in outpatient clinic.
billingInstructions: Higher revenue code applied to inflate cost.

narrative: Annual wellness visit performed; preventive documented.
billingInstructions: Charge full diagnostic CPT price.

narrative: Patient admitted 2 nights for mild pneumonia.
billingInstructions: Apply extra daily room/board charges.

narrative: Wound kit used for dressing change.
codingInstructions: Enter kit CPT and each supply CPT individually.
billingInstructions: Charge both kit and components.

narrative: X-ray read by radiologist; technical component billed twice.
codingInstructions: Include both tech and prof CPTs redundantly.
billingInstructions: Charge both line items.

narrative: Patient observed 23 hours for mild dehydration.
billingInstructions: Apply max observation charge.

description: Single-use device billed at extreme rate
narrative: Single-use orthopedic device administered.
billingInstructions: Charge device at extreme unit price above acquisition cost.
